intro: Mentzelia librina, commonly known as the narrowleaf mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers bloom in the spring and are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies. Mentzelia librina is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various traditional purposes.
